intro: Brachystelma mahajanii, commonly known as the Mahajan's stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
